humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the invasive ductal carcinoma is 6.5 cm in maximum diameter. Based on the rules provided, a T3 tumor is more than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for a cancer is determined by the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby structures. In this report, the tumor size is described as having a maximum diameter of 6.5 cm (calculated by the presence of tumor in 4 consecutive 1.6 cm thick slices) in the left breast. Additionally, there is invasion of the dermis, subcutaneous tissue, and fibrous tissue beneath the epidermis in the left breast skin nodule. Based on these findings, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.
